solution_line_template: First find how many ml of water Jason needs for 1 gram of charcoal: {water_per_charcoal_ratio_ml} ml / {charcoal_per_charcoal_ratio_g} grams = <<{water_per_charcoal_ratio_ml}/{charcoal_per_charcoal_ratio_g}={ml_per_gram_charcoal}>>{ml_per_gram_charcoal} ml/g

Then divide the amount of water Jason uses by the amount of water per gram of charcoal to find how much charcoal he uses: {total_water_ml} ml / {ml_per_gram_charcoal} ml/g = <<{total_water_ml}/{ml_per_gram_charcoal}={total_charcoal_g}>>{total_charcoal_g} g
